text: The Llano de Chocolate Beds is a geological unit of sedimentary rock in Atacama Region of Chile. Sediments forming the rock deposited during the Carboniferous and Permian. Lithologies include conglomerate, green sandstone and limestone. It was formerly considered part of the Triassic-aged Canto del Agua Formation. Llano de Chocolate Beds was deposited in an ancient forearc basin. == References == Category:Geologic formations of Chile Category:Carboniferous System of South America Category:Carboniferous Chile Category:Pennsylvanian Series Category:Cisuralian Series Category:Permian System of South America Category:Permian Chile Category:Conglomerate formations Category:Sandstone formations Category:Limestone formations Category:Carboniferous southern paleotemperate deposits Category:Permian paleotemperate deposits Category:Geology of Atacama Region
title: Llano de Chocolate Beds
